Posts.Content: Hi all-- I was diagnoses a few weeks ago and head to surgery tomorrow. It is getting harder to sleep. My PCP gave me some generic Xanax, which I half, but I've been starring at ceiling since half the night. Please tell me that after surgery I will begin to sleep.
Posts.Title: Can't sleep, too anxious

Posts.Content: Oops. I was fairly nondescript. Masectomy and sentinel lymph node dissection. I have IDC grade 2.
Posts.Signature: per biopsy 2/7/12: IDC grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2-neu+ pathology post radical mastectomy 2/29/12: DCIS, largest tumor 5.2 cm, 1/7 LNs, stage III
Posts.Title: Can't sleep, too anxious

Posts.Content: met with my oncologist last week for my treatment plan and yes, per oncology visit, breast cancer will spread to three main sites, bone being on of those sites, so lower back pain due to a tumor would make sense. Best wishes to your sister. Hope that answer are soon obtained. I like having info, solid quantifiable info, and a treatment plan to keep me moving forward.
Posts.Signature: per biopsy 2/7/12: IDC grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2-neu+ pathology post radical mastectomy 2/29/12: DCIS, largest tumor 5.2 cm, 1/7 LNs, stage III
Posts.Title: My Sister just got diagnosed with Breast Cancer possibly Stage IV to the spine

Posts.Content: Got home 12 hours ago from mastectomy/full axillary node dissection (sentinel node was positive--dang). Hospital first night was sleepless, not from surgery pain, but from IV site pain. Glad to have that IV out and to be out of hospital. My hubby is great nurse, an ortho OR nurse, and has been doing the drain thing for me, etc. Any tips on recovery?
Posts.Signature: per biopsy 2/7/12: IDC grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2-neu+ pathology post radical mastectomy 2/29/12: DCIS, largest tumor 5.2 cm, 1/7 LNs, stage III
Posts.Title: Home versus Hospital

Posts.Content: Still have a few weeks before chemo starts, and am curious if a wig will be worth the investment? Now that the season is changing, I actually foresee myself wearing a scarf/hat more than a wig. However, there will be family pictures at a wedding, and I don't want to be remembered as the sick person with the bald head wearing a scarf. I just don't feel like I'm going to be a wig person. Any comments?
Posts.Signature: per biopsy 2/7/12: IDC grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2-neu+ pathology post radical mastectomy 2/29/12: DCIS, largest tumor 5.2 cm, 1/7 LNs, stage III
Posts.Title: How much did you use your wig during hair-loss chemo?

Posts.Content: Am going to have a port-a-cath placed immediately preceding my first chemo session next week. Seems like a good thing to have done, as I will be having 17 infusions over a year, but it does scare me, as does anything that involves incisions and sutures, but then I don't like needles either, and this should be better than trying to find a small vein in my solo arm 17 times, right?
Posts.Signature: per biopsy 2/7/12: IDC grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2-neu+ pathology post radical mastectomy 2/29/12: DCIS, largest tumor 5.2 cm, 1/7 LNs, stage III
Posts.Title: Anyone Not Liking Their Port-a-Cath?
